TopicTitle: Kerbal Truck Simulator 2015: KMC M2 King Cab & Flatbed!

Articles.Content:
SCS Software, the creators of Euro Truck Simulator 2 made an April Fool's post about Kerbal Truck Simulator, so I replied with a

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FhQMxS2QXws?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 sometime earlier this month.
I took some time today to clean up the KMC M2 craft files so they are sharable. 

Two variants of the M2 electric truck are offered:

**1) Crew Cab**

[http://kerbalx.com/pandoraskitten/KMC-M2-Crew-Cab-Truck](http://kerbalx.com/pandoraskitten/KMC-M2-Crew-Cab-Truck)

![ekJJTnB.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ekJJTnB.jpg)

This is an all purpose configuration with a self-contained sleeper module, fuel tanks to service aircraft or small rockets, and a short bed strong enough to serve as a rocket launch pad. Feel free to modify the truck to any configuration you desire or use the chassis for other purposes.

**2) Flatbed**

[http://kerbalx.com/pandoraskitten/KMC-M2-Flatbed-Truck](http://kerbalx.com/pandoraskitten/KMC-M2-Flatbed-Truck)

![ZNbOiKj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ZNbOiKj.jpg)

![eJhAtz5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/eJhAtz5.jpg)

The flatbed can accommodate 5 meter payloads and is tested up to 8 tons with Tim Yam's [custom cat command module](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116405-Tim-Yam-s-Spaceliner-Habitats-Birds-of-Prey-Walmart-Galactic-and-Cats-in-Space%21).

Nice job! These trucks looks really cool! You reminded me of my [old ones](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88413-Army-civil-and-sport-trucks-pack-%28with-suspension%29)... 

Are you going to build new trucks?

A bit too small for my liking, if supposed to be lorry-size.

If i wanted to build a lorry, i would take the european lorry considering Euro TS came before American TS, and because i live in Europe.

Then i have some "fun" trying to find a picture of a lorry next to a regular car, side by freaking side.

![Plateau_de_Saclay_le_4_juin_2013_-_145.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/70/Plateau_de_Saclay_le_4_juin_2013_-_145.jpg)

Best i could find, which is good considering i already have a Citroen-like vehicle in KSP.

Then take one of my regular cars i built in KSP and build from there.

And smaller size lorries are about a 650 I-beam taller than a Van.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T20:15:37Z" title="04/26/2015 08:15  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by KotDemopan**

Yes the M2 is ridiculously small, but scales well to the size of the Kerbals themselves. I do intend to build a semi truck with working 5th wheel hitch next, and that one will be much larger as I intend to follow the American sleeper cab template ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I am just wondering what to put inside the (huge) engine cowl as I am not using any internal combustion engine mods at the moment. 

Maybe a radial propeller engine to see a spinning fan inside, for lulz.

@Nik\_601 - really good designs! I will definitely take some inspiration and use more stock parts. Your O2 copters are great as well, simulating ducted fan appearance with the big SAS modules.
